escaperoom

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • escaperoom.Game

  • final class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Randomly generates successive rooms. User must move through rooms using intuitive console commands.
    Version:
    3/15/17
    Author:
    NTropy, Charles Dorsey-Ward, Timothy Dovci, Samantha Cole

      • eastDoor

        private static boolean eastDoor
        Tracks continuity, e.g. if player left room on east side they begin on west side of next room.

      • northDoor

        private static boolean northDoor
        Tracks continuity, e.g. if player left room on east side they begin on west side of next room.

      • southDoor

        private static boolean southDoor
        Tracks continuity, e.g. if player left room on east side they begin on west side of next room.

      • westDoor

        private static boolean westDoor
        Tracks continuity, e.g. if player left room on east side they begin on west side of next room.

      • runToggle

        private static boolean runToggle
        Tracks if player is sprinting. If true, player moves two spaces at a time. If false, player moves one space at a time.

      • start

        private static boolean start
        Tracks if player is in the first room. Used to determine how a room should be initialized.

      • trophy

        private static boolean trophy
        Easter egg trophies in game, tracks if player has picked one up.

        private static int code
        Code for door of room.
